title: Low interest rates have cost savers roughly half a trillion dollars
description: Historically low rates of interest have helped the U.S. economy recover from the Great Recession. But there have been casualties. Savers — and the wider economy — have lost interest income from deposits and investments that could total $500 billion. This probably hurt those who are retired, or on a fixed income, the most.Click the audio player above to hear the full story.

itunes:subtitle: The post-crisis financial policy has a downside.
